item.title: By Not Tapping Russian Assets for Ukraine, Europe Showed Its Fear
item.description: Europe has demonstrated that when faced with Russian threats and intimidation, the continent struggles to stand strong.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: Rheinmetall, KNDS Get Near $5 Billion German Army Order for Puma Tanks
item.description: The order for 200 tanks for the German military adds to the windfall the companies are seeing as Europe steps up its defense spending.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Kirby

item.title: EU Delays Mercosur Deal Sign-Off to January
item.description: Commission president Ursula von der Leyen said the signature was pushed out to January to give a few more weeks to address some outlying issues with member states.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: U.K. Government Borrowing Fell, But Challenges Ahead
item.description: The narrower November deficit was largely due to an increase in revenues following the government’s decision to increase a tax on employment.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: EU Commits to $105 Billion Loan to Ukraine—but Without Russian Assets
item.description: The bloc is divided about how to confront Russia over its war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Bondi Beach Heroes Show Why Everyday People Run Toward Danger
item.description: The world was transfixed by stories of bystanders trying to stop the gunmen. But ordinary people often respond to such violence with bravery.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Trump Tackles Concerns Over Taiwan Strategy With Massive Weapons Deal
item.description: The $11.1 billion sale came after a string of episodes that stirred disquiet about the U.S. president’s appetite to face down China.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: The Bank of Japan Raised Rates. Here’s Why You Should Care.
item.description: Rate rises in Japan ripple through global markets and might even push up the cost of borrowing in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: Opinion | Another U.S. Pinprick Strike at The Hague
item.description: Unless the ICC faces more serious consequences, it could target Trump after 2028.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | My Family Survived Bondi Beach
item.description: We expected peace when we moved from Israel to Australia. The war followed us.
item.dc:creator: Arsen Ostrovsky

item.title: Pope Leo XIV Appoints Illinois Bishop to Succeed New York Cardinal Timothy Dolan
item.description: As archbishop, Ronald Hicks will lead the second-largest U.S. archdiocese.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Walker

item.title: Arrest of U.S. Employees Processing Asylum Claims for White South Africans Sparks Row
item.description: South Africa said the arrests of seven Kenyan nationals working at an American refugee-processing center were part of an operation aimed at curbing illegal immigration and visa abuse.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Trump Ups Pressure on Venezuela but Repeatedly Shifts the Rationale
item.description: The president has shied away from endorsing regime change, leaving some aides unsure about his ultimate goal.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Trump’s Gaza Peace Plan Stumbles Over Hamas Disarmament
item.description: Hamas is refusing to give up its weapons and control of Gaza, causing a domino effect that is keeping the rest of the plan from falling into place.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: Opinion | China and Russia Bolster Their ‘No Limits’ Alliance
item.description: Xi and Putin have their differences, but they are united in their desire to weaken America.
item.dc:creator: Seth G. Jones

item.title: U.S. Approves $11 Billion in Arms Sales to Taiwan, Angering Beijing
item.description: The packages include Himars truck-based missile launchers, howitzers, missiles and antitank drones.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: How the Global Threat From ISIS Lives On, Years After Its Caliphate Fell
item.description: A sophisticated propaganda machine grooms would-be attackers before directing them to instructions for violence on the dark web.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Israel, Egypt Sign $35 Billion Gas Deal
item.description: The deal comes even as tensions between the two countries have been high because of the war in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: New Iran-Linked Cyberattack Targets Former Israeli Prime Minister
item.description: Israel has battered Iran on the battlefield, but Tehran has notched a series of embarrassing breaches targeting government agencies and officials.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: EU’s Von Der Leyen Says Green Light for Mercosur Deal of Enormous Importance
item.description: The European Commission president urged EU leaders to approve the long-awaited trade deal after it faced more pushback at the 11th hour.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: Rheinmetall Joint Venture Wins $2 Billion Space-Reconnaissance Contract
item.description: Rheinmetall ICEYE Space Solutions will provide the German armed forces with images via its satellite constellation.
item.dc:creator: Mauro Orru

item.title: The $8 Billion Black Market for Venezuelan Oil Is Suddenly Closing Down
item.description: About 70% of the country’s oil exports rely on a fleet of sanctioned vessels now being targeted by the U.S. military.
item.dc:creator: Shelby Holliday

item.title: Opinion | A Reparations Loan for Ukraine?
item.description: Europe considers a legal work-around to seize Russian assets.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Don’t Stop at a Single Oil Tanker
item.description: Whatever happened to the ‘maximum pressure’ sanctions on Iran?
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | ‘Dhurandhar,’ India’s New Movie About Islamic Terrorism, Is a Hit
item.description: Bollywood isn’t known for realism, but this film grapples seriously with a global threat.
item.dc:creator: Sadanand Dhume

item.title: Bolivia Bets on Lithium—and the U.S.—to End Its Economic Slump
item.description: The new pro-U.S. government is seeking a financial lifeline from the Trump administration, the foreign minister said in an interview.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: Canada’s Population Falls in Third Quarter, First Decline Since Pandemic Lockdowns
item.description: Preliminary demographic estimates indicate the country’s population declined by 76,068 between July 1 and Oct. 1, a drop of 0.2% that took the population down to 41.58 million.
item.dc:creator: Robb M. Stewart

item.title: Putin Warns He Will Achieve Aims in Ukraine Through Negotiation or War
item.description: The Kremlin leader called European leaders backing Ukraine “piglets” who wanted to feed on Russia’s collapse.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: After Bondi Suspects’ Trip, Philippines Hunts for Signs of ISIS-Linked Resurgence
item.description: The south of the country was long a hotbed of radicalism, but years of military campaigns have pushed extremists to the fringes.

item.title: Franco-German Defense Group KNDS to Go Public in Dual Listing
item.description: Formed from the combination of Germany’s Krauss-Maffei Wegmann and France’s Nexter, the company has emerged as a key beneficiary of demand from the war between Russia and Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Mauro Orru

item.title: Bondi Beach Shooting Suspect Charged With Terrorism, Murder
item.description: Police charged 24-year-old Naveed Akram after he woke up from a coma.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: U.K. Inflation Slows to Eight-Month Low as BOE Prepares Rate Decision
item.description: Prices cooled more than expected in November, keeping the Bank of England on course for a fourth interest-rate cut of the year.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: For Ukraine’s Allies in Europe, a Bad Deal With Russia Is Worse Than No Deal
item.description: A deeper agenda is driving Europe’s support for Kyiv: self-preservation.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Michaels

item.title: Trump Orders Blockade of Sanctioned Oil Tankers In and Out of Venezuela
item.description: The president’s announcement further escalates pressure on leader Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Costas Paris

item.title: U.S. Tanker Seizure Has Paralyzed Venezuelan Oil Shipping—Except Chevron’s
item.description: Vessels are idling at ports or veering away from the region. But for Chevron, it’s business as usual.
item.dc:creator: Kejal Vyas

item.title: White House Sends Angry Message to Israel Over Killing of Hamas Commander
item.description: President Trump complained Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was derailing “my deal” to halt the Gaza war and rebuild the shattered enclave, aides said.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Panama Ports Deal Hits Impasse as China Makes New Demands for Its Approval
item.description: Beijing threatened to block the BlackRock-led deal to buy ports unless state-owned Cosco gets a majority stake.
item.dc:creator: Costas Paris

item.title: Bondi Beach Attack Badly Shakes Sense of Safety for Australia’s Jews
item.description: There has been frustration among Sydney’s Jewish community that authorities haven’t heeded warnings about a rise in antisemitism.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Bondi Beach Shooters Motivated by Islamic State, Australia Says
item.description: Police said they found two homemade Islamic State flags alongside improvised explosive devices in a car.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: Breach at South Korea’s Equivalent of Amazon Exposed Data of Almost Every Adult
item.description: Tens of millions of names, phone numbers and other sensitive information were leaked in a breach that went undetected for months.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: U.S. Strikes Three Alleged Drug Boats, Killing Eight
item.description: There is little indication of the administration’s campaign abating, even as the justification for the strikes comes under the spotlight.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Sugden

item.title: After a Generation of Peace, Europe Tells Its People to Prepare for War
item.description: As President Trump tries to negotiate a peace deal in Ukraine, European leaders sound the alarm that Russia could target their countries next.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: What to Know About the Use of U.S. Surrogacy by China’s Billionaires
item.description: A WSJ investigation shows how Chinese elites are building mega-families by using a largely unregulated American system.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: Hong Kong Court Convicts Publisher Jimmy Lai, Whom Trump Has Vowed to Free
item.description: The 78-year-old symbol of China’s protest crackdown faces a possible life sentence.
item.dc:creator: Austin Ramzy

item.title: Rival Kingpins of Russian Oil Trade Hit by EU Sanctions
item.description: The two traders were targeted in a big swing by the bloc at a clandestine market that has bankrolled Moscow’s war against Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Costas Paris

item.title: After Backlash, Jared Kushner Drops Plan to Build a Trump Hotel in Serbia
item.description: For more than two years, the U.S. president’s son-in-law had sought to build a complex of towers in a central Belgrade site once bombed by NATO.
item.dc:creator: Deborah Acosta

item.title: Korea Zinc to Build $7.43 Billion Smelter in U.S.
item.description: The world’s largest zinc smelter aims to produce key metals and minerals, under a joint venture in Clarksville, Tenn.
item.dc:creator: Kwanwoo Jun

item.title: Father and Son Used Licensed Firearms in Sydney Terror Attack, Police Say
item.description: The Australian prime minister said the suspects acted alone, as he called for tighter gun controls after the deadly Hanukkah shooting.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miao

item.title: China Vanke Shares Fall After Bondholders Reject Debt Extension Proposal
item.description: The property developer said it will hold a bondholder meeting on Thursday to discuss next steps.
item.dc:creator: Jiahui Huang

item.title: China’s Economy Is Deteriorating on Several Fronts
item.description: The broad-based weakening spans consumer spending, investment and real estate.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miao

item.title: Terrorist Attack Targets Jews at Sydney’s Bondi Beach, Killing 15
item.description: The suspects are a father, also killed, and his son, in the shooting at a Hanukkah event.

item.title: Belarus Frees Nobel Winner, Political Prisoners After U.S. Eases Sanctions
item.description: The moves come as relations thaw between Washington and Minsk.
item.dc:creator: Annie Linskey

item.title: Charles III Gives ‘Good News’ on Cancer Treatment
item.description: The British monarch, who was diagnosed last year, said his treatment is due to be scaled back in 2026.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: U.S. Forces Raid Ship, Seize Cargo Headed to Iran From China
item.description: A U.S. special operations team boarded a ship in the Indian Ocean last month and seized military-related articles headed to Iran from China, U.S. officials said, an operation aimed at blocking Tehran from rebuilding its military arsenal.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: U.K. Economy Contracts Again, Likely Cementing BOE Rate Cut
item.description: Economic activity dipped 0.1% on month in October. Economists polled by The Wall Street Journal had expected an increase.
item.dc:creator: Don Nico Forbes

item.title: Britain Asked a Power Plant to Build a ‘Fish Disco.’ It’s Not Going Well.
item.description: Plans to use a deep-sea boom box to keep fish away from a coastal nuclear station have gone awry. DJing for marine life, it turns out, is a nightmare.
item.dc:creator: Eliot Brown

item.title: Crumbling Peace Deals Show Limits of Trump’s Approach to Ending Wars
item.description: The president has claimed credit for ending wars in Congo and at the Thai-Cambodian border, but fighting continues.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Meet the Multinational Cast of Fighters Inside a Ukrainian POW Camp
item.description: Fighters from among 30 nationalities are taking stock of their next step as the U.S. pushes peace talks that would free all prisoners. Many say they plan to go to Russia rather than return to their homelands.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: U.S. Blueprint to Rewire Economies of Russia, Ukraine Sets Off Clash With Europe
item.description: Undisclosed appendices to current peace proposals detail the Trump administration’s plan to unlock frozen Russian funds held in Europe and bring Moscow in from the cold.
item.dc:creator: Drew Hinshaw

item.title: 100 Nigerian Students Freed After Kidnapping at Catholic School
item.description: The Nigerian government said 100 of the students abducted from a Catholic school just over two weeks ago have been freed.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Trump-Brokered Cease-Fire Crumbles on Thai-Cambodian Border
item.description: The Thai army said it launched airstrikes in response to earlier fire from the Cambodian side.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: ‘India’ and ‘Let My Country Awake’ Review: History at an Audacious Scale
item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.

item.title: U.A.E.’s Ransom Payment for Kidnapped Prince Bolsters al Qaeda in Mali
item.description: Jihadists received millions of dollars as they blockade the country’s capital and security across the region deteriorates.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Russia and India’s Complicated Relationship Hinges on Oil
item.description: The two countries’ reliance on each other in the energy sector is coming under strain.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Putin and Modi Deepen Relationship That Has Drawn Trump’s Anger
item.description: The Russian president is embarking on a high-profile visit to India, aiming to protect a partnership that is a crucial for Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: For First Time in Decades, Child Deaths Will Rise This Year
item.description: Almost a quarter of a million more children around the world are projected to die in 2025 than in 2024.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: Pakistan Points Finger at India Over Suicide Blast
item.description: The accusation came as India’s prime minister vowed to find the perpetrators of a separate deadly explosion on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Car Explosion in India’s Capital Kills Eight
item.description: Indian officials said it was too early to say if the blast was the result of a bomb.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Trump Signals Support for Selling Submarines to Australia
item.description: The president’s comments calmed fears that he would pull out of the Biden-era deal and came as he struck an agreement with the U.S. ally on rare earths.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
